formats.name: micro_manifesto
formats.instruction: Declare your personal philosophy or credo on a topic in exactly three short sentences. Be uncompromising, poetic, or radical.

formats.name: if_then_scenario
formats.instruction: Imagine a surprising 'If X, then Y' scenario about your chosen subject. Briefly set up the premise, then describe the outcome.

formats.name: puzzle_post
formats.instruction: Present an intriguing puzzle or paradox relating to your topic. Frame it with context, then let readers try to solve or ponder it. Do NOT provide the solution.

formats.name: rant_relay
formats.instruction: Go on a 60-second mental rant—stream-of-consciousness style—about what's bugging you in this area. Let frustration or enthusiasm spill out without editing.

formats.name: reverse_advice
formats.instruction: Offer advice for doing something wrong deliberately. Write two sentences explaining why someone might choose the 'bad path,' then list three ironic 'tips.'

formats.name: semantic_autopsy
formats.instruction: Dissect a single word or phrase that’s relevant. Explain how it’s misunderstood, abused, or fascinating in at least two paragraphs. Add personal reflections.

formats.name: timeline_twist
formats.instruction: Describe how your topic would look if history unfolded differently. Write a brief alternate timeline, highlight one key difference, and its consequences.

formats.name: ingredient_breakdown
formats.instruction: Take apart a popular idea or trend like a recipe. List its 'ingredients,' then mix them into a short 'how to' or 'why it works.'

formats.name: story_in_six
formats.instruction: Write a complete story about your topic in exactly six sentences. Make it vivid, surprising, or funny—no explanations.

formats.name: fuzzy_future_forecast
formats.instruction: Predict what will happen next in your topic, but embrace uncertainty—lean into odd possibilities, speculate wildly, and show doubt.

title_styles: Write a mysterious teaser title. Example: 'What happened after midnight nobody expected.'
Write a listicle-style title. Example: 'Four ways tech is secretly ruining our days.'
Write a poetic or metaphorical title. Example: 'The garden of lost ideas blooms again.'
Write a title that frames the post as a challenge or dare. Example: 'Prove me wrong: Sleep is overrated.'
Write a title with a dramatic twist. Example: 'This trend looked perfect until the data arrived.'
structure_variants: Begin with a personal anecdote, then expand to the broader issue.
Start in the middle of a conversation—quote someone, then respond in your own words.
Use only numbered lists, no paragraphs or narrative.
Describe something as if you’re creating a guide for aliens unfamiliar with Earth.
Write as a monologue from your future self looking back.
topic_angles: Hidden economies and informal trade in everyday life.
The role of accidental discoveries in history and innovation.
How social rituals shape online community behavior.
Confessions about mistakes with technology or tools.
